events.title: General Cunningham Advocates Coastal Center Attack in Strategic Military Briefing
events.description: On the 29th September General Cunningham gave me his appreciation and plan.f Of the two courses General Cunningham preferred that of an attack from the centre along the coast. He explained the reasons for his choice in his appreciation and again at a meeting of the three Commanders-in-Chief.

events.title: "X-Craft Strategize Retreat and Submarine Coordination Following Alten Fiord Attack"
events.description: Io4. X-craft who were able to withdraw after the attack were to endeavour to contact a submarine patrolling in one of the sectors off Alten Fiord. If unable to make contact, they were to make for one of the bays off the north coast of Soroy, which, circumstances permitting, would be closed and examined by certain of the patrolling submarines on the nights of the a7th/28th and 28th/29th September.

events.title: "Stormy Seas Force STUBBORN to Abandon Sandfiord Coverage, Head Back to Base"
events.description: tog. STUBBORN had still not covered Sandfiord which was on her beat, and during the day she attempted to communicate with TRUCULENT, to request her to cover Sandfiord that night: but she failed to get in touch. However, the weather, wind force 6 from the west and sea and swell 5-6,* decided STUBBORN against attempting to close the land once more: it might have meant losing X.r10: and at o600Z on the 29th September STUBBORN with X.to in tow proceeded by the route ordered to return to base at slow speed;

events.title: "X-Craft Commanders Directed to Seek Submarine Aid Following Fiord Assault"
events.description: Io4. X-craft who were able to withdraw after the attack were to endeavour to contact a submarine patrolling in one of the sectors off Alten Fiord. If unable to make contact, they were to make for one of the bays off the north coast of Soroy, which, circumstances permitting, would be closed and examined by certain of the patrolling submarines on the nights of the a7th/28th and 28th/29th September.

events.title: "STUBBORN Faces Adverse Weather, Abandons Sandfiord Coverage Amidst Communication Breakdown"
events.description: tog. STUBBORN had still not covered Sandfiord which was on her beat, and during the day she attempted to communicate with TRUCULENT, to request her to cover Sandfiord that night: but she failed to get in touch. However, the weather, wind force 6 from the west and sea and swell 5-6,* decided STUBBORN against attempting to close the land once more: it might have meant losing X.r10: and at o600Z on the 29th September STUBBORN with X.to in tow proceeded by the route ordered to return to base at slow speed;

events.title: "Melbourne Star Docks at Gibraltar After Smooth Voyage"
events.description: 165. After an uneventful passage MELBOURNE STAR arrived at Gibraltar at 0700 on 29th September (D.5).

events.title: "Canadian and Kiwi Forces Advance in Italy; Heavy Rains Ignite Stubborn Enemy Resistance"
events.description: Â» The Canadians crossed the Marecchia by Rimini on 21st September and the next day the New Zealanders passed through 1 Canadian _ Division to exploit up the coast. 5 Corps also reached the river on the 22nd, having mopped up the Coriano area, and on the 23rd exploited forward to make contact with the ridge be-. tween the Marecchia and the Uso. By the 25th the enemy was generally back behind the Usa but not in very good order and advances were made all along the Army front. In the plains we had cleared the whole eastern bank of the Fiumicino by 29th September but the enemy was still holding out in the foothills south of Route 9 when the rain descended with great violence for four successive days. All the fords over the Marecchia and Uso became impassable and the approaches to the bridges, necessarily more congested, were in very bad condition; the Fiumicino, normally a shallow trickle, swelled to a width of thirty feet and its speed and depth made it impossible for infantry patrols to cross. Going off the roads became quite impossible. The enemy took heart from this to maintain a steadfast resistance and it was not until 5th October that the
